intro: Cenekia rapunculoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrweed, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, burr-like fruits that aid in seed dispersal by attaching to animals or clothing. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
